extracted_information: Semaphore is a zero-knowledge protocol designed as a privacy layer for dApps on Ethereum. It allows users to cast anonymous messages as provable group members without revealing identity and prevents double-signaling. It uses off-chain JavaScript libraries and on-chain Solidity contracts that work in tandem.

features.name: Anonymous Messaging
features.description: Cast a message (e.g., vote, endorsement) as a provable group member without revealing identity.

features.name: Double-Signaling Prevention
features.description: Mechanism to prevent users from casting multiple messages with their nullifier.

features.name: Zero-Knowledge Proofs
features.description: Ensures user joined the group and hasn't cast a message with their nullifier.

developer_information.api_structure: Library-based interaction: off-chain JavaScript libraries for identity creation, group management, proof generation; on-chain Solidity contracts for group management and proof verification.
developer_information.ease_of_integration: Designed to be simple and generic. Encourages modular application design, allowing developers to choose and customize components. Minimal effort required to generate and verify proofs.
developer_information.documentation_quality: Comprehensive documentation available including: 'Getting started', 'Guides', 'Technical reference', 'Deployed contracts', 'Trusted Setup', 'Subgraph', 'Benchmarks', 'Glossary', 'Resources', 'Code editors and LLM setup', 'Troubleshooting', 'FAQ'. Specific guides available for key developer flows.

code_examples_and_flows.group_membership_proof: Detailed developer flow available via 'Add their Semaphore identity to a group' guide.
code_examples_and_flows.anonymous_signals: Detailed developer flow available via 'Send a verifiable, anonymous message' guide.
code_examples_and_flows.identity_creation: Detailed developer flow available via 'Create a Semaphore identity' guide.
